member.name: T:WaveEngine.Common.Graphics.Blend
member.summary: Blend factors, which modulate values for the pixel shader and render target.

member.name: F:WaveEngine.Common.Graphics.Blend.Zero
member.summary: The data source is the color black (0, 0, 0, 0). No pre-blend operation.

member.name: F:WaveEngine.Common.Graphics.Blend.One
member.summary: The data source is the color white (1, 1, 1, 1). No pre-blend operation.

member.name: F:WaveEngine.Common.Graphics.Blend.SourceColor
member.summary: The data source is color data (RGB) from a pixel shader. No pre-blend operation.

member.name: F:WaveEngine.Common.Graphics.Blend.InverseSourceColor
member.summary: The data source is color data (RGB) from a pixel shader. The pre-blend operation inverts the data, generating 1 - RGB.

member.name: F:WaveEngine.Common.Graphics.Blend.SourceAlpha
member.summary: The data source is alpha data (A) from a pixel shader. No pre-blend operation.

member.name: F:WaveEngine.Common.Graphics.Blend.InverseSourceAlpha
member.summary: The data source is alpha data (A) from a pixel shader. The pre-blend operation inverts the data, generating 1 - A.

member.name: F:WaveEngine.Common.Graphics.Blend.DestinationAlpha
member.summary: The data source is alpha data from a rendertarget. No pre-blend operation.

member.name: F:WaveEngine.Common.Graphics.Blend.InverseDestinationAlpha
member.summary: The data source is alpha data from a rendertarget. The pre-blend operation inverts the data, generating 1 - A.

member.name: F:WaveEngine.Common.Graphics.Blend.DestinationColor
member.summary: The data source is color data from a rendertarget. No pre-blend operation.

member.name: F:WaveEngine.Common.Graphics.Blend.InverseDestinationColor
member.summary: The data source is color data from a rendertarget. The pre-blend operation inverts the data, generating 1 - RGB.

member.name: F:WaveEngine.Common.Graphics.Blend.SourceAlphaSaturate
member.summary: The data source is alpha data from a pixel shader. The pre-blend operation clamps the data to 1 or less.

member.name: F:WaveEngine.Common.Graphics.Blend.BlendFactor
member.summary: The data source is the blend factor set with BlendStates. No pre-blend operation.

member.name: F:WaveEngine.Common.Graphics.Blend.InverseBlendFactor
member.summary: The data source is the blend factor set with SetBlendState. The pre-blend operation inverts the blend factor, generating 1 - blend_factor.

member.name: F:WaveEngine.Common.Graphics.Blend.SecondarySourceColor
member.summary: The data sources are both color data output by a pixel shader. There is no pre-blend operation. This options supports dual-source color blending.

member.name: F:WaveEngine.Common.Graphics.Blend.InverseSecondarySourceColor
member.summary: The data sources are both color data output by a pixel shader. The pre-blend operation inverts the data, generating 1 - RGB. This options supports dual-source color blending.

member.name: F:WaveEngine.Common.Graphics.Blend.SecondarySourceAlpha
member.summary: The data sources are alpha data output by a pixel shader. There is no pre-blend operation. This options supports dual-source color blending.

member.name: F:WaveEngine.Common.Graphics.Blend.InverseSecondarySourceAlpha
member.summary: The data sources are alpha data output by a pixel shader. The pre-blend operation inverts the data, generating 1 - A. This options supports dual-source color blending.

member.name: F:WaveEngine.Common.Graphics.BlendOperation.Min
member.summary: Find the minimum of source 1 and source 2.

member.name: F:WaveEngine.Common.Graphics.BlendOperation.Max
member.summary: Find the maximum of source 1 and source 2.

member.name: F:WaveEngine.Common.Graphics.BlendStateRenderTargetDescription.SourceBlendColor
member.summary: This blend option specifies the operation to perform on the RGB value that the pixel shader outputs. The BlendOp member defines how to combine the SrcBlend and DestBlend operations.

member.name: F:WaveEngine.Common.Graphics.BlendStateRenderTargetDescription.DestinationBlendColor
member.summary: This blend option specifies the operation to perform on the current RGB value in the render target. The BlendOp member defines how to combine the SrcBlend and DestBlend operations.

member.name: F:WaveEngine.Common.Graphics.BlendStateRenderTargetDescription.BlendOperationColor
member.summary: This blend operation defines how to combine the SrcBlend and DestBlend operations.

member.name: F:WaveEngine.Common.Graphics.BlendStateRenderTargetDescription.SourceBlendAlpha
member.summary: This blend option specifies the operation to perform on the alpha value that the pixel shader outputs. Blend options that end in _COLOR are not allowed. The BlendOpAlpha member defines how to combine the SrcBlendAlpha and DestBlendAlpha operations.

member.name: F:WaveEngine.Common.Graphics.BlendStateRenderTargetDescription.DestinationBlendAlpha
member.summary: This blend option specifies the operation to perform on the current alpha value in the render target. Blend options that end in _COLOR are not allowed. The BlendOpAlpha member defines how to combine the SrcBlendAlpha and DestBlendAlpha operations.

member.name: F:WaveEngine.Common.Graphics.BlendStateRenderTargetDescription.BlendOperationAlpha
member.summary: This blend operation defines how to combine the SrcBlendAlpha and DestBlendAlpha operations.

member.name: F:WaveEngine.Common.Graphics.RasterizerStateDescription.MultisampleEnable
member.summary: Specifies whether to use the quadrilateral or alpha line anti-aliasing algorithm on multisample antialiasing (MSAA) render targets. Set to TRUE to use the quadrilateral line anti-aliasing algorithm and to FALSE to use the alpha line anti-aliasing algorithm. For more info about this member, see Remarks.

member.name: F:WaveEngine.Common.Graphics.SamplerStateDescription.Filter
member.summary: Filtering method to use when sampling a texture.

member.name: F:WaveEngine.Common.Graphics.SamplerStateDescription.AddressU
member.summary: Method to use for resolving a u texture coordinate that is outside the 0 to 1 range.

member.name: F:WaveEngine.Common.Graphics.SamplerStateDescription.AddressV
member.summary: Method to use for resolving a v texture coordinate that is outside the 0 to 1 range.

member.name: F:WaveEngine.Common.Graphics.SamplerStateDescription.AddressW
member.summary: Method to use for resolving a w texture coordinate that is outside the 0 to 1 range.

member.name: F:WaveEngine.Common.Graphics.SamplerStateDescription.MipLODBias
member.summary: Offset from the calculated mipmap level. For example, if Direct3D calculates that a texture should be sampled at mipmap level 3 and MipLODBias is 2, then the texture will be sampled at mipmap level 5.

member.name: F:WaveEngine.Common.Graphics.SamplerStateDescription.MaxAnisotropy
member.summary: Clamping value used if D3D11_FILTER_ANISOTROPIC or D3D11_FILTER_COMPARISON_ANISOTROPIC is specified in Filter. Valid values are between 1 and 16.

member.name: F:WaveEngine.Common.Graphics.SamplerStateDescription.ComparisonFunc
member.summary: A function that compares sampled data against existing sampled data.

member.name: F:WaveEngine.Common.Graphics.SamplerStateDescription.BorderColorVector
member.summary: Border color to use if D3D11_TEXTURE_ADDRESS_BORDER is specified for AddressU, AddressV, or AddressW. Range must be between 0.0 and 1.0 inclusive.

member.name: P:WaveEngine.Common.Graphics.SamplerStateDescription.BorderColor
member.summary: Gets or sets Border color to use if D3D11_TEXTURE_ADDRESS_BORDER is specified for AddressU, AddressV, or AddressW. Range must be between 0.0 and 1.0 inclusive.

member.name: F:WaveEngine.Common.Graphics.SamplerStateDescription.MinLOD
member.summary: Lower end of the mipmap range to clamp access to, where 0 is the largest and most detailed mipmap level and any level higher than that is less detailed.

member.name: F:WaveEngine.Common.Graphics.SamplerStateDescription.MaxLOD
member.summary: Upper end of the mipmap range to clamp access to, where 0 is the largest and most detailed mipmap level and any level higher than that is less detailed. This value must be greater than or equal to MinLOD.

member.summary: Set the stencil data to the reference value.

member.summary: Increment the stencil value by 1, and clamp the result.

member.name: F:WaveEngine.Common.Graphics.StencilOperation.DecrementSaturation
member.summary: Decrement the stencil value by 1, and clamp the result.

member.name: F:WaveEngine.Common.Graphics.StencilOperation.Increment
member.summary: Increment the stencil value by 1, and wrap the result if necessary.

member.name: F:WaveEngine.Common.Graphics.StencilOperation.Decrement
member.summary: Decrement the stencil value by 1, and wrap the result if necessary.

member.name: T:WaveEngine.Common.Graphics.TextureAddressMode
member.summary: Identify a technique for resolving texture coordinates that are outside of the boundaries of a texture.

member.name: F:WaveEngine.Common.Graphics.TextureAddressMode.Wrap
member.summary: Tile the texture at every (u,v) integer junction. For example, for u values between 0 and 3, the texture is repeated three times.

member.name: F:WaveEngine.Common.Graphics.TextureAddressMode.Mirror
member.summary: Flip the texture at every (u,v) integer junction. For u values between 0 and 1, for example, the texture is addressed normally; between 1 and 2, the texture is flipped (mirrored); between 2 and 3, the texture is normal again; and so on.

member.name: F:WaveEngine.Common.Graphics.TextureAddressMode.Clamp
member.summary: Texture coordinates outside the range [0.0, 1.0] are set to the texture color at 0.0 or 1.0, respectively.

member.name: F:WaveEngine.Common.Graphics.TextureAddressMode.Border
member.summary: Texture coordinates outside the range [0.0, 1.0] are set to the border color specified in SamplerStateDescription or HLSL code.

member.name: F:WaveEngine.Common.Graphics.TextureAddressMode.Mirror_One
member.summary: Similar to D3D11_TEXTURE_ADDRESS_MIRROR and D3D11_TEXTURE_ADDRESS_CLAMP. Takes the absolute value of the texture coordinate (thus, mirroring around 0), and then clamps to the maximum value.

member.name: M:WaveEngine.Common.Math.BoundingOrientedBox.ContainsRelativeBox(WaveEngine.Common.Math.Vector3@,WaveEngine.Common.Math.Vector3@,WaveEngine.Common.Math.Matrix@)
member.summary: Determine whether the box described by half-extents hA, axis-aligned and centered at the origin, contains the box described by half-extents hB, whose position and orientation are given by the transform matrix mB. The matrix is assumed to contain only rigid motion; if it contains scaling or perpsective the result of this method will be incorrect.
member.param: Position and orientation of second box relative to first box
member.returns: ContainmentType enum indicating whether the boxes are disjoin, intersecting, or whether box A contains box B.

member.name: M:WaveEngine.Common.Math.BoundingOrientedBox.ConvertToFrustum
member.summary: Convert this BoundingOrientedBox to a BoundingFrustum describing the same volume. A BoundingFrustum is defined by the matrix that carries its volume to the box from (-1,-1,0) to (1,1,1), so we just need a matrix that carries our box there.

member.returns: Cartesian coordinate of the specified point with respect to the axis being used.

member.remarks: This method enlarges this rectangle, not a copy of it. The rectangle is enlarged in both directions along an axis. For example, if a 50 by 50 rectangle is inflated by 50 in the x-axis, the resultant rectangle will be 150 units long (the original 50, the 50 in the minus direction, and the 50 in the plus direction) maintaining the rectangle's geometric center. If either x or y is negative, the is deflated in the corresponding direction.

member.name: M:WaveEngine.Common.Math.Vector3.TransformCoordinate(WaveEngine.Common.Math.Vector3@,WaveEngine.Common.Math.Matrix@,WaveEngine.Common.Math.Vector3@)
member.summary: Performs a coordinate transformation using the given .
member.param: When the method completes, contains the transformed coordinates.
member.remarks: A coordinate transform performs the transformation with the assumption that the w component is one. The four dimensional vector obtained from the transformation operation has each component in the vector divided by the w component. This forces the wcomponent to be one and therefore makes the vector homogeneous. The homogeneous vector is often prefered when working with coordinates as the w component can safely be ignored.

This forces the wcomponent to be one and therefore makes the vector homogeneous. The homogeneous vector is often prefered when working with coordinates as the w component can safely be ignored.
